results.title: Sales Rep for Residential Leasing Platform
results.description:
ShowMojo streamlines the residential rental process, and vastly improves the leasing experience for property managers and renters alike. Our company is growing rapidly, with customers in all 50 states. To learn more about us visit: showmojo.com

Values

ShowMojo strives to connect individuals that closely align with our values:

  • Do you have the confidence to exchange opinions in an open environment with respectful candor?
  • Are you self-directed and able to proactively solve problems?
  • Do you pride yourself on showing up prepared and feel personal responsibility to see your accountabilities through to completion?

If this resonates with your personal values, we would like to have a career discussion with you.

Overview

We are looking for US based sales professionals who are self-motivated, have positive energy, and bring enthusiasm into the role. Our sales team members enjoy working independently, but also interact in healthy team-based collaboration.

ShowMojo's sales team uses an online approach to land business-to-business sales. This starts with prospecting and warming up leads to build a funnel of interested prospects, progresses into online demos and closing calls to get to the sale, and finishes off with follow-up calls to ensure the sale is onboarded and happy.

Activities throughout the week can vary. Some days could have a heavy focus on dialing and prospecting to refresh your pipeline. Other days could be filled with online demos, where you need to present and demonstrate sometimes complicated concepts (related to leasing automation and emerging leasing best practices) in simple, user-friendly terms. Other days could be closing calls and building your referral chain.

Some travel is required. You'll be expected to attend up to a dozen trade shows and industry-related events each year. Property management or real estate experience -- while helpful -- is not required for this position. We will help you get up to speed on the domain.

Our company is fully remote. We hire based on technical self-reliance. You should be comfortable (and even excited) working with and learning about current technologies.

Requirements

  • Have meaningful experience with cold calling and closing calls. Solid and professional written communication skills.
  • Ability to professionally and personably communicate with business owners and critical stakeholders.
  • Have experience presenting with online tools like Zoom, Join.me or Webex.
  • Self-manage your prospecting and sales activities -- calling, emailing and demoing throughout the day -- in order to hit daily, weekly and monthly targets.
  • Maintain new and existing customer connections and activities within our CRM.
  • Have a quiet office (home or elsewhere) with a strong internet connection and a newer computer.

Benefits

This is a salaried position, including both base and commission. The advertised compensation range combines both salary and commission.

Available benefits include health insurance, dental, vision, and 401k.

results.title: Chief Growth Officer
results.description:
About Us

imaware's mission is to change the world of healthcare and at-home testing. There's never been a more important time to help empower people to take control of and understand their health - all while pushing the boundaries of what 'modern healthcare' should really look like. We're looking for people who will help us think bigger, challenge the status quo, and add to a collaborative mindset of continuous learning. We are obsessed with creating a seamless and simple experience to make sure that our patients are well cared for, no matter where our products meet them in their journey. imaware‚Ñ¢ team members all have a shared passion for answering tough questions in the pursuit of helping our customers, and one another.

Our team has adapted to a hybrid work environment, and work collaboratively both in our Austin office and from home. Despite many of our team members being in different locations and time zones, we're putting in the effort to make sure that our people are connected, cared for, and supported so we can all participate in building a culture that stems from a shared purpose.

As a result, imaware was named as one of BuiltIn's Best Small Places to Work for 2022!

About the Role

imaware's evolution from strictly a direct-to-consumer home-based testing product to a much larger business-to-business offering and digital healthcare platform has created tremendous opportunities ahead! We find ourselves on the cusp of explosive growth and are looking for an experienced Chief Growth Officer who can not only lay the foundations of our sales organization, but also inform key product decisions, grow, and cultivate existing accounts, and consistently close on new business.

Reporting to the Chief Executive Officer, the Chief Growth Officer will be responsible for growing imaware's B2B business, building imaware's sales and GTM strategy, and the development of key partnerships to increase sales and market value. As a subject matter expert in the medical, health, and wellness space, you will inform Product team members on key market demands, and act as a true business ally for all Partners to tailor the absolute best solution for them and their customers. You will sign new MSAs, support Customer Experience teams, formulate a larger sales strategy, build a sales playbook, and ultimately grow our market footprint across key areas. If you're excited to sell more than just a product, but a larger story that will ultimately impact the health and happiness of countless patients, then here are just a few achievements we can't wait to see you accomplish:

‚óè Critical key leadership role on the Executive Leadership team and an external ambassador of the company

‚óè Build a strong sales team to support targeted market segments

‚óè Sign new, strategic MSAs in order to meet annualized revenue goals and markedly improve our market footprint across major segment areas

‚óè Lead the Customer Experience and Client Success teams with the progress of existing Partners, building new revenue streams through additional tailored offerings

‚óè Collaborate with other cross-functional departments, from building out a go-to-market strategy ideating new offerings with Product, budgeting and forecasting with Finance & Accounting, to working with Lab Operations on new testing capabilities

‚óè Research, formulate, codify, and execute on a repeatable sales strategy and playbook that will be used to train future business development and customer success team members

Minimum Requirements

‚óè 15+ years of hands-on sales or business development and leadership experience selling services and solutions, primarily within the health and wellness market (ideally diagnostics)

‚óè Successful track record of building go-to-market strategies across functions and exceeding sales goals, targets, and selling complex SaaS solutions to the C-Suite and executive level in life sciences

‚óè Demonstrable experience selling products and services with nuanced and variable pricing models, working with Finance & Accounting on budgeting, forecasting, and invoicing

‚óè Experience working with various sales CRMs, Marketing and Lead Gen solutions, and Business Intelligence solutions (Salesforce, etc.)

‚óè Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills, able to build relationships while persuading key decision-makers

‚óè Willingness to travel up to approximately 50% of the year

Preferred Qualifications

‚óè Prior experience working within a startup or early-stage company is highly preferred

‚óè Prior senior leadership experience building and leading teams

‚óè Prior knowledge of lab testing preferred

‚óè Bachelor's degree

Benefits and Perks

‚óè Partially and fully covered medical benefits

‚óè Fully covered dental, vision, life, short and long-term disability

‚óè Paid vacation and holidays

‚óè Flexible work environment

‚óè 401K

‚óè 20 days of PTO

‚óè $75 continuing education stipend per quarter

‚óè Free imaware tests

‚óè Virtual and in-person team building activities/social events

Sound like a great fit? Apply now, we'd love to meet you!

results.title: Senior Manager of Partner Enablement

  • Startup experience. You‚Äôve helped build new businesses from the ground up
  • Have familiarity with common SaaS tooling such as Hubspot, ZoomInfo, and implementing PRM systems is a plus

Bonus - experience we'd love to see

  • A passion for sustainability - You care about climate change and want to be part of the solution

¬†

Interested? Great - we'd love to talk to you! Please apply to the role on our website https://boards.greenhouse.io/sustainlife.¬†

If you don‚Äôt check every box, don‚Äôt let that stop you. We prioritize talent, passion, and drive over what looks good on paper. If you‚Äôre on the fence, we encourage you to hit the apply button and highlight what draws you to Sustain.Life.

Sustain.Life is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minority/Women/Disability/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation/Age

¬†

Who we are:

Sustain.Life is a high-energy early-stage Climate Tech start-up that focuses on providing ESG solutions to our customers to support their ambitions to address the most challenging questions of our time. Our sustainability platform specializes in B2B solutions for corporate sustainability efforts, offering innovative technology solutions and industry experience to support business targets, personal goals and a vision of a sustainable future for everybody on the planet. We are building a team that will help our users launch sustainability programs,, benchmark their ESG performance, measure carbon emissions, set meaningful goals, execute reduction strategies, and ultimately share their progress with key stakeholders. We are on a mission to create best-in-class software that changes the world.

Join us in our mission! We are a fully remote workforce collaborating across US, UK and Ireland. We have an incredible team of world-class experts, designers and technologists developing our sustainability platform, and we were finalists in the 2022 SXSW. We believe in our mission, and we are looking for like-minded individuals to join us and help us grow.

At Sustain.Life, we take our mission seriously. In 2021, our entire carbon footprint was only 120 Metric Tons of carbon, which we offset on behalf of our employees. Our platform helps us understand our impact on the environment and to take the necessary steps to reduce that impact.

results.title: Senior Account Executive
results.description:
About Metomic

Over the last ten years, SaaS has changed the way we work ‚Äî for the better. Slack instead of email. Miro instead of sticky notes. Airtable instead of Excel. SaaS is helping tech companies move so much faster, but it‚Äôs also introducing a new surface area of risk they‚Äôve never seen before. The risk of leaking sensitive data. As a result, companies are faced with answering the difficult question of how to manage compounding security risks as they grow without introducing more red tape that slows their team members down.

At Metomic, we help tech companies save time & reduce costs by minimising their sensitive data footprint in cloud applications like Slack, Google Drive and Zendesk.

Our technology includes native integrations with dozens of cloud apps, AI to detect thousands of sensitive data types, and advanced functionality to manipulate data at scale (redaction, retention, access controls, etc). All from one place. This liberates tech companies to make full use of their favourite SaaS apps as they grow, whilst Metomic takes care of all the security risks behind the scenes.

After launching our product in April 2021, we now count some of the world‚Äôs most innovative companies as customers, such as Zego, Clearcover, Omnipresent, Travelperk and Jumio. Our revenue is growing quickly and we‚Äôre backed by some great investors like Connect (investors in CityMapper, Typeform, Marvel), LocalGlobe (Improbable, Figma, Zego) and RFC (Hopin, Clubhouse, On Deck, etc).

Our Team

We count some of the world‚Äôs most innovative companies as customers, such as Jumio, Zego, Clearcover, Omnipresent and TravelPerk. We‚Äôre entering a really exciting period in our growth journey and are looking to welcome two Senior Account Executives to the team to be part of this.

You will be responsible for building relationships with executives and decision-makers (usually CTOs, CIOs and CISOs), gaining a strong understanding of their business needs and priorities, and owning the sales delivery cycle from qualified lead through to onboarding transition with our Customer Success team.

We‚Äôve set ambitious targets as a business and you will have ownership of a personal target each quarter. We‚Äôve invested, and continue to invest, in the best tools on the market for our sales team so you can focus on what matters most.

We take learning and career development seriously and want Metomic to be an environment where you can grow and develop your skills down whatever path you‚Äôre most interested in. Some of our sales team have moved into more specialised roles, been promoted to new roles, or taken on people leadership responsibilities. We also have sales learning forums and ‚ÄòRevenue Hour‚Äô where we come together as a team to move things forward and invest time in our own upskilling.

What you'll be doing

  • Own and deliver on a revenue target - You will be accountable for running the full sales process from initial outbound activity through to onboarding transition to the Customer Success team. You will be expected to prioritise the right opportunities and create urgency from start to finish. This will include:
    • Generating new opportunities from targeted outbound activity, referrals and networking (this is a ground-up role with.
    • Qualifying opportunities, building demand and carrying out deep discovery of the client‚Äôs needs.
    • Helping prospects evaluate the Metomic platform effectively and building business cases for ROI (through demos and running POCs)
    • Negotiating and closing deals to meet quarterly revenue targets
  • Contribute to our GTM strategy - You‚Äôll work closely with our SDRs to tailor messaging, approach and cadence, and with the wider Sales, Marketing and Leadership team on strategies for growing our presence across the market.
  • Contribute to our learning culture of the sales team - We are big on feedback and learning opportunities, so we‚Äôll look to you to support other members of the sales team as we grow.
  • Develop product expertise - You will build your understanding of our product and industry to position yourself as a trusted advisor and expert to our prospects and be responsible for feeding back valuable product and market insights into our product and engineering teams.

Requirements

  • Proven sales professional with 5+ years experience in a B2B SaaS environment - You‚Äôll be proven at leading sales cycles with autonomy and demonstrate a track record of over-achievement in sales, across both mid-market and enterprise and with technical solutions.
  • Natural new business hunter who can build an outbound sales strategy, prioritise accounts and prospects to target, experiment with messaging and confidently book meetings.
  • Passionate self-starter who can learn and execute independently
  • A strong listener who is inquisitive and curious - you‚Äôll be building relationships, asking probing questions, actively listening to pain points and understanding how prospective customers might benefit from Metomic.
  • Very strong written and presentation skills - you‚Äôll be the face and words of Metomic, so you‚Äôll take time to sharpen messaging, pay close attention to details and communicate with impact.
  • Values- and relationship-driven - We‚Äôre a small, friendly and tight-knit team and we value kindness and empathy. You‚Äôll own an individual target but also contribute to our sales team culture and team growth.
¬†
Our recruitment process

We know your time is important and want to make sure our recruitment process provides both of us a really authentic and meaningful insight into what it would be like working together, so we‚Äôre planning on the following stages:

  • Intro Call (30 mins) This will focus on your motivations and interests, your journey to date and some of the experiences you‚Äôve had, along with a chance to share more about Metomic and the Sales Team
  • Skills Interview (1 hour) This will focus on your sales experience, decision-making and discuss our sales approach in more detail
  • Practical Interview (1 hour). This will involve a practical activity focused on written communication and presentation skills.
  • Interview with Rich Vibert, CEO (30 mins) - This will be an opportunity to speak with Rich, our CEO and Co-Founder, to learn more about our journey and strategy.

Benefits

Compensation

¬†Our story

Partly's mission is to connect the world's parts and we're doing that by building the first global platform for replacement parts, starting with auto parts. Our big vision is to accelerate the world towards a sustainable future where waste is eliminated and all replacement parts are universally searchable, accessible and available to all.

We've more than tripled our team over the last 12 months and expect to double in size again over the coming 12 months. We're a global team spanning both Europe and Australasia. Founded by ex-Rocket Lab engineers, we utilise bleeding-edge technology to solve challenging but exciting problems that make a huge impact in a $1.9 trillion industry.

We provide a scalable digital infrastructure solution to some of the world's largest businesses and the most exciting startups. Partly's solutions are integrated across hundreds of companies globally, providing the backbone for cataloguing and managing parts online.

Blackbird Ventures (Canva, CultureAmp etc.) led both our Pre-Seed and Seed rounds, alongside I2BF (NYC), Hillfarrance, Icehouse, Peter Beck (Rocket Lab), Akshay Kothari (Notion Co-Founder) and Dylan Field (Figma Co-Founder).

We're continuing to build a world-class team and ensuring Partly is a place where people can do the best work of their lives. We're proud of the culture we've built at Partly, and our values¬†are lived throughout every experience.

¬†This role

As our Enterprise Sales Lead (EU) you will be a founding hire for our German office and responsible for building out our customer base across Europe. You will be working alongside our Chief Strategy Officer and Senior Account Executive. You are a natural chaser and may have been a high-performing AE or BDE previously. You have a track record of winning new business and are looking for your next big challenge at a fast-growing company where you can quickly start making an impact.

You achieve results by being empathetic and customer-focused. You build long-lasting relationships and are not just a script follower, but an incredible storyteller. You understand the technical details and can create new solutions for your customers' problems that align internally. You also act like an owner to develop and document processes where there are none today and have the discipline to design your day to make yourself most effective.

You will report to¬†Tony Austin¬†(Co-founder and Chief Strategy Officer).

¬†What will you do
  • Lead and manage our enterprise sales pipeline across a wide range of global and European businesses including, e-commerce Marketplaces, Automotive Manufacturers, Retailers & Distributors
  • Nurture the customer relationship from the first interaction, assess customer needs and pain points, prepare and deliver presentations and demos, follow up with prospects, assemble proposals, negotiate deals and work together with the wider team to convert deals into high-value paying customers.
  • Contact prospective customers by email, LinkedIn, video message or phone (or any other method you feel will help you reach prospects and close deals). You will be approaching prospects with highly targeted and personalised outreach encouraging them to book a call to explore how Partly can revolutionise their businesses.
  • Maintain an extremely healthy and clean pipeline. Obsess over each of our prospects to ensure deals are progressing and no opportunities are missed.
  • Optimise for revenue by negotiating large deals and upselling prospects with additional services and value-adds.
  • Help develop our Enterprise sales playbook with sales strategies, processes and tactics.
  • Communicate cross-teams to solve customer problems and relay customer feedback to the product team, engineers, and company executives.
  • Work closely with the product team to represent the voice of the customer and industry trends by gathering, summarising and sharing the most pressing issues facing our prospects and customers.
  • Identify ways to provide customers with the information and answers they need before they have to ask the questions.
  • Rapidly learn, grow and develop faster than the business, positioning yourself as a future leader at Partly.
¬†Your skills
  • Experience in Technology related Sales, Key Account Management or Business Development within a start-up or fast-growing company.
  • Experience with automotive businesses or knowledge of the parts industry
  • Demonstrated experience in Enterprise Selling, strategic execution in large multi-national accounts
  • Demonstrated experience engaging across all levels from C-level Executives to developers/architects.
  • Proven success managing time and juggling multiple accounts in a high-growth environment, while exceeding customer expectations
  • Business proficiency in the English language
  • (Bonus) Personal interest or passion for Cars or Motorsport
  • (Bonus) Experience in e-commerce and helping companies sell online
  • (Bonus) Part retailer or manufacturer rolodex
  • (Bonus) Experience working with a diverse range of geographies, cultures and linguistic backgrounds
¬†Benefits
  • Competitive base salary plus equity. Even though we're a small startup, we offer competitive salaries and great equity.
  • Generous parental leave and flexible return to work.
  • Flexible working hours and location. We have an office-first culture but you can work remotely or from home whenever it suits you. There are no fixed hours so you can choose to work when you're most effective.
  • Ergonomic office. Sit-stand desks, ergonomic chairs, quiet spaces, and collaboration spaces to suit all kinds of working styles.

results.title: Account Associate, Education
results.description:
Status: Full-time

Type: Exempt

Reports to: Senior Director of Education

ABOUT TECHCHANGE

Want to be part of a growing company that is using technology, pedagogy, and design to bring about positive social change? Founded in 2010, we are a social enterprise that works with leading nonprofits and government agencies worldwide to push the boundaries of what's possible in virtual learning and online events. From delivering an online series of courses on COVID response for frontline health workers to powering the world's largest human rights and tech conference (RightsCon), TechChange contributes to some of the most innovative and important conversations of our era.

TechChange provides human-powered services like facilitation, production, support, and design and a user-centric platform to support over 500K users across some 800 courses, workshops, and events.¬†

ROLE OVERVIEW

The Account Associate is an entry-level role for candidates interested in developing their client-facing, curriculum development, and virtual learning/collaboration tool belt. They work collaboratively and proactively with education team members to support the development and launch of beautiful and engaging learning experiences on topics that matter in a variety of formats such as courses, workshops, and learning events. In this role, you will support the creation of powerful learning experiences to achieve partner success in alignment with TechChange pedagogical best practices.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

On a typical day, Account Associates may work individually, or with a project team. A successful candidate will undertake the following duties and more as instructed by the Account Manager:¬†

  • Assist in the planning and implementation of projects
  • Help to coordinate and manage project tasks and deliverables, as assigned
  • Configure interactive learning experiences in native TechChange platform, informed by project design and client's needs
  • Support live learning events (moderating breakout discussions, supporting learnings of participants/clients)¬†
  • Analyze data as required
  • Recommend tools, activities, and design elements to improve students' overall experience
  • Liaise and coordinate deliverables with creative team and resources
  • Liaise with project stakeholders concerning project details and deliverables, as assigned
  • Act as a reliable team contributor by collaborating with colleagues on solution development and serving as a resource to Education team colleagues
  • Provide feedback into systems and processes that will improve role effectiveness contributing to inter-and-cross-team initiatives as needed
  • Develop and maintain knowledge and understanding of TechChange business and offerings
  • Perform other duties assigned by the Account Manager in an orderly and efficient manner
SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS
  • 1-3 years of workforce experience¬†
  • Highly organized and detail-oriented
  • Familiarity with teaching, education, and/or instructional design preferred
  • Ability to upskill quickly in new and evolving technical and SaaS software
  • Excellent interpersonal skills for collaborating effectively with others¬†
  • A self-starter who can multitask, work well under pressure, and work efficiently to meet strict deadlines while maintaining quality¬†
  • Ability to maintain understanding of project purpose and objectives
  • Poses an analytical and critical mindset for making the best decisions for successfully executing duties¬†
  • Competent public speaker and written/verbal communicator¬†
  • Highly coachable: takes feedback and appropriately applies at next available opportunity (Growth Mindset)¬†
  • Technical skills not required, a plus:
    • Virtual facilitation tools: Miro, Slido or Mentimeter, Zoom (or similar video conferencing tools)¬†
    • Project Management tools: Monday.com etc.¬†
  • Fluency in English required. Fluency in additional languages is highly valued
REMOTE/TIME ZONE CONSIDERATIONS

Remote (distributed, work-from-home structure); flexible east coast hours while serving global clients.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

The position will require extensive time sitting or standing and viewing computer screens from a home setup. The following capabilities may be required to perform this position's essential functions. Reasonable accommodations can be made available to address the following requirements.

  • May occasionally lift, carry, stoop, bend, etc. (no more than 20 pounds).
  • Ability to travel in the US and internationally (less than 10% time, when appropriate)
COMPENSATION

Salary range: $55,000 - $65,000 annually

BENEFITS
  • 3 weeks of paid time off¬†
  • 5-day winter shutdown
  • 10 company holidays
  • Parental leave¬†
  • Paid Sabbatical Leave
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision Plans
  • 401k, with company matching (eligible after 6 months)
  • Discretionary Profit Sharing Program
  • Professional development funding
  • Remote work¬†
APPLICATION DEADLINE¬†

Open until filled.¬†

EOE STATEMENT

TechChange is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. We know that our differences make us better. TechChange does not discriminate based on race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.

results.title: Sales Development Representative
results.description:
About Novata

Novata is a public benefit corporation created and funded by a unique consortium of foundations and private sector companies including the Ford Foundation, the Omidyar Network, S&P Global, and Hamilton Lane. We are a for-profit, mission-driven company with a goal of empowering the private markets to build a more inclusive and sustainable form of capitalism. By bringing together the brightest minds in financial data, private equity, social justice and inclusive capitalism, we aim to build the best technology and tools for the private markets to better collect, analyze, benchmark, and report ESG (Environmental, Social, Governance) data. We have an experienced and diverse team who are as ambitious about growing a successful company as we are about making an impact. We hope you‚Äôll join us.

About the role

We‚Äôre looking for a results-driven sales development representative to actively seek new business opportunities, engage and build relationships with potential customers. You will provide complete and appropriate solutions for every potential customer to boost top-line revenue growth, customer acquisition levels, and profitability.

Requirements

¬†

About you

¬†

Work Style

  • Excellent communication and negotiation skills
  • Ability to deliver engaging presentations
  • Quick on your feet
  • Positive, won‚Äôt quit attitude
  • Prospecting
  • Listening
  • Product Knowledge

Benefits

We want our employees to have the best opportunities at work and in life. We know that requires us to provide more than just a great place to work. We are committed to providing industry-leading benefits and flexibility that allow you to achieve all your life goals. Here are the important highlights:

  • Competitive salary reviewed annually to account for market shifts

¬†

Why Join Us?

Novata is a mission-first company built to enable the private markets to drive more impact. We are at the unique intersection of ESG, the private markets, and mission-driven impact. We are well-funded, have a top-tier executive leadership team, and have experienced a successful commercial launch in the first half of 2022. We have a highly aggressive growth plan to establish ourselves as the industry leader of ESG with immediate plans for product and international expansion.

Members of our leadership team have been globally recognized for their success as leaders of large public companies, founders of successful startups, leaders of established ESG organizations, and builders of robust tech platforms. We are passionate, highly motivated, and experienced individuals who embrace our diverse backgrounds. Together, we will become the platform of choice and a catalyst for a change in the way business is done.

Novata is an Equal Opportunity Employer and it is our policy that we will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other protected category with respect to recruitment, hiring, training, promotion and other terms and conditions of employment.
